about_the_game:
Abnormal1999 Series


Abnormal1999 is a series of independent games developed by QZQStudio, based on science fiction backgrounds such as quantum mechanics and multiverse, and integrates elements of exploration, horror, puzzle solving, and reasoning.
The protagonist is a girl named SU, and the story revolves around her and her family. SU can freely travel in the fourth dimension for some reason. She wants to figure out what happened and find a way home.
In the process, she uses this ability to travel to different times and spaces in parallel universes, meet all kinds of people and things, encounter various branches, and lead to different realities.

The Abnormal1999 series adopts a continuous update mode, releasing a new episode every month to tell the story and adventure of SU.
This episode, "Hyperspace," is the fourth episode of the first season of Abnormal1999.
The first three episodes are "With in the Obscurity", "Apartment of Death", and "SU".

Overview::


SU knew she was different when her time and space were in chaos.
Frequently jumping to different eras made her feel like she was going crazy. She saw herself as a child, met her father and mother from the past, and wanted to understand the mystery of her origin.




Gameplay:


Search for evidence items
Solve puzzles
Deduce the truth

Objective:

Solve the time puzzles to uncover the truth about your origins.

A Word from the Author


In the Anomaly 1999 series, due to the introduction of quantum mechanics and multiverse theory, the game will become more mind-boggling. You may need to read and interact repeatedly to get the truth, which may be interesting or boring. In this series of games, you don't have to play in the order of the game's release time. You can enter the Anomaly 1999 series from any episode. I will provide fresh experiences in each episode of this series. I hope you like it.

content_descriptors.notes:
This game contains some mild horror elements and adult themes. While there are tension-building sequences meant to be unnerving, the game does not depict excessive graphic violence or gore.

The storyline explores mature subject matter, including supernatural occurrences and disturbing situations. However, it does not contain any explicit sexual content. There are references to alcohol and drug use in certain contexts.

Potentially unsettling topics such as death, mental instability, and psychological trauma are present, but they are portrayed respectfully without gratuitous detail. There may be some jump scares and creepy imagery/environments.

Overall, the game maintains a suspenseful and eerie tone rather than relying on shocking visceral content. However, parental guidance is still recommended for younger audiences due to the game's mature thematic elements and unsettling horror overtones throughout the experience.

name: Abnormal1999:Hyperspace

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or higher
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-2500K or AMD Athlon X4 740 (or equivalent)
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 660 (2048 MB) or Radeon R9 285 (2048 MB) - Integrated GPUs may work but are not supported.
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 6 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

steam_germany.descriptors:
Drastische Gewalt
Alkohol / Tabak
Sexuelle Andeutungen

short_description: Play as SU, a time-traveling girl, in this hardcore 3D detective/puzzle game. Collect clues, solve puzzles, and use deduction to uncover her mysterious origin. This is episode four of Abnormal1999, a monthly narrative series blending exploration, horror, puzzles, and quantum mechanics.
supported_languages:
English*, Simplified Chinese, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Japanese, Polish, Portuguese - Brazil, Portuguese - Portugal, Russian, Spanish - Latin America, Traditional Chinese
*languages with full audio support
